column2: The contribution of waste management operators to recycling of plastics
column5: The reduction of food waste can lead to a decrease in the amount of waste sent to landfills, which in turn can reduce the need for waste management operators to recycle plastics, potentially having a negative impact on the target of recycling 30% of plastics in vehicles.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing food waste can lead to a decrease in the overall amount of waste, which can then lead to a decrease in the need for recycling plastics.

column2: At least 20% of the carbon used in the chemical and plastic products should be from sustainable non-fossil sources
column5: The target of promoting sustainable and socially responsible production methods and circular business models in food processing and retail may not directly impact the use of sustainable non-fossil sources in chemical and plastic products.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on the chemical and plastic industry, while the other focuses on food processing and retail.

column2: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall be reduced
column5: The reduction of GHG emissions from shipping can contribute to the overall goal of reducing emissions and increasing the competitiveness of the EU's agri-food trade.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from shipping can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Aviation fuel suppliers shall ensure that Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) made available to aircraft operators at each Union airport will be at least 2% from 2025
column5: The increased use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel can reduce emissions from aviation, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from aviation can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Of the SAF targets reported above, synthetic aviation fuels should represent a minimum share of 1.2% from 2030
column5: The increased use of synthetic aviation fuels can reduce emissions from aviation, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from aviation can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1% in 2025 and 5.5% in 2030
column5: The increased use of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin can reduce emissions from transport, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Member States with maritime ports shall endeavour to ensure that as of 2030 the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin (RFNBOs) in the total amount of energy supplied to the maritime transport sector is at least 1.2%
column5: The increased use of RFNBOs in maritime transport can reduce emissions from shipping, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from shipping can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050 relative to 1990
column5: The reduction of emissions from the transport sector can contribute to the overall goal of reducing emissions and increasing the competitiveness of the EU's agri-food trade.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030
column5: The reduction of fuel intensity in fisheries can contribute to the overall goal of reducing emissions and increasing the competitiveness of the EU's agri-food trade.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from fisheries can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years
column5: The reduction of costs in combined transport operations can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing costs in transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: For [...] “urban buses” manufacturers shall comply with the 90% (in the reporting period 2030-2034) and 100% (as from 2035) minimum shares in their fleet of new heavy-duty vehicles
column5: The increased use of zero-emission urban buses can reduce emissions from transport, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles [...], off-road vehicles and off-road special purpose vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019
column5: The reduction of CO2 emissions from heavy-duty vehicles can contribute to the overall goal of reducing emissions and increasing the competitiveness of the EU's agri-food trade.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: The share of biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part B of Annex IX in the energy content of fuels and electricity supplied to the transport sector shall, except in Cyprus and Malta, be limited to 1.7%
column5: The limitation on the use of biofuels and biogas produced from certain feedstocks may not directly impact the competitiveness of the EU's agri-food trade.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on the transport sector, while the other focuses on the agri-food trade.

column2: The yearly quantity of aviation fuel uplifted by a given aircraft operator at a given Union airport shall be at least 90% of the yearly aviation fuel required, to avoid tankering practices which would bring additional emissions from extra weight
column5: The reduction of tankering practices can contribute to the overall goal of reducing emissions and increasing the competitiveness of the EU's agri-food trade.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from aviation can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: In the first phase, from 2020 up to 2024, the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU
column5: The increased use of renewable hydrogen can reduce emissions from transport and industry, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport and industry can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, at the end of each year, the following power output targets are met cumulatively: (a) for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 1.3 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations
column3: and (b) for each light-duty plug-in hybrid vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 0.80 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations.
column6: The increased use of electric vehicles can reduce emissions from transport, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column7: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them offering a power output of at least 600kW and including at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.
column5: The increased use of electric vehicles can reduce emissions from transport, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030 (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets), along the TEN-T core road network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km between them [...].
column5: The increased use of electric vehicles can reduce emissions from transport, making the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from transport can make the EU's agri-food trade more competitive and sustainable.

column2: Genetic biodiversity of food production systems: Secure and ensure access to a range of quality seeds for plant varieties in order to adapt to the pressures of climate change.
column5: The focus on genetic biodiversity of food production systems may not directly impact the recycling of plastics in vehicles.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on food production systems, while the other focuses on waste management.

column2: Reduce food waste
column5: Reducing food waste can lead to a decrease in the amount of waste sent to landfills, which in turn can lead to a reduction in GHG emissions from shipping.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing food waste can lead to a decrease in emissions from shipping.

column2: Circular economy: Scale-up and promote sustainable and socially responsible production methods and circular business models in food processing and retail.
column5: The promotion of circular economy practices in food processing and retail can lead to a reduction in emissions from aviation, as sustainable aviation fuels can be produced from waste biomass.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing waste and promoting circular economy practices can lead to a reduction in emissions from aviation.

column2: Consumption footprint: Reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system, operating within planetary boundaries.
column5: The reduction of the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system can contribute to the overall goal of reducing emissions from transport.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that reducing emissions from food production and consumption can make the EU's transport sector more sustainable.

column2: Income distribution: Ensure fair income and salaries.
column5: The fair distribution of income and salaries can lead to a reduction in fuel intensity in fisheries, as fishermen and fishing communities may be more likely to adopt sustainable practices.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that fair income distribution can lead to more sustainable practices in fisheries.

column2: Sectorial growth: Help farmers and fishers to strengthen their position in the supply chain and to capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production.
column5: The growth of the agricultural and fisheries sectors can lead to a reduction in costs in combined transport operations, as more efficient and sustainable practices are adopted.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that sectorial growth can lead to more efficient and sustainable practices in transport.

column2: Market power and business structure: Improve agricultural rules that strengthen the position of farmers (e.g. producers of products with geographical indications), their cooperatives and producer organisations in the food supply chain.
column5: The improvement of agricultural rules can lead to a reduction in emissions from transport, as more efficient and sustainable practices are adopted.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that improving agricultural rules can lead to more sustainable practices in transport.

column2: Price: Preserve the price affordability of food.
column5: The preservation of price affordability of food may not directly impact the installation of renewable hydrogen electrolysers.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on food prices, while the other focuses on energy production.

column2: Trade: Foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector.
column5: The competitiveness of the EU supply sector can lead to a reduction in GHG emissions from shipping, as more efficient and sustainable practices are adopted.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that a competitive supply sector can lead to more sustainable practices in shipping.

column2: Digitalisation and knowledge transfer. Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas to achieve the objective of 100% access by 2025
column5: The increased access to fast broadband can lead to a reduction in emissions from transport, as more efficient and sustainable practices are adopted.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that digitalisation can lead to more sustainable practices in transport.

column2: Transport, accessibility and infrastructure: Create shorter supply chains will support reducing dependence on long-haul transportation.
column5: The creation of shorter supply chains can lead to a reduction in costs in combined transport operations, as more efficient and sustainable practices are adopted.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that shorter supply chains can lead to more efficient and sustainable practices in transport.

column2: Employment and working conditions: Create new job opportunities.
column5: The creation of new job opportunities can lead to a reduction in emissions from transport, as more people are employed in sustainable sectors.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that job creation can lead to more sustainable practices in transport.

column2: Social protection and poverty: Ensure fair, inclusive and ethical value chains.
column5: The focus on social protection and poverty may not directly impact the installation of renewable hydrogen electrolysers.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on social protection, while the other focuses on energy production.

column2: Animal welfare: Promote better animal welfare to improve animal health and food quality.
column5: The promotion of animal welfare may not directly impact the use of sustainable aviation fuels.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on animal welfare, while the other focuses on energy production.

column2: Food messaging: Provide food information and labelling to empower consumers to make informed, healthy and sustainable food choices.
column5: The provision of food information and labelling can lead to a reduction in emissions from transport, as consumers make more sustainable choices.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that informed consumers can lead to more sustainable practices in transport.

column2: Food availability: Improve availability of sustainable food.
column5: The improvement of food availability can lead to a reduction in costs in combined transport operations, as more efficient and sustainable practices are adopted.
column6: The connection between the two targets is based on the idea that food availability can lead to more efficient and sustainable practices in transport.

column2: Food affordability: Ensure affordability to sufficient, nutritious and sustainable food.
column5: The focus on food affordability may not directly impact the installation of renewable hydrogen electrolysers.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on food prices, while the other focuses on energy production.

column2: Properties of food: Increase reformulation of food products in line with guidelines for healthy and sustainable diets.
column5: The reformulation of food products may not directly impact the use of sustainable aviation fuels.
column6: There is no clear connection between the two targets, as one focuses on food reformulation, while the other focuses on energy production.
